title: Can I update to Marshmallow after a carrier switch on my M9?

thread.text:
Ok so just about every carrier sent out their Marshmallow update back in February. Every carrier except AT&T.
Question is, if I switch from AT&T to T-Mobile, would I be elegible to receive the android update from T-Mobile? My M9 is AT&T branded (with their logo on the back) so I figured, no, but wanted to make sure.
On a side note, can I transfer prepaid AT&T number to prepaid AT&T T-Mobile?
AT&T is beyond horrible and can't wait to get away from them.
Thanks.

Welcome to Android Central! You have to be on the original carrier associated with the phone in order to get the official system update over the air. Otherwise, you could try using HTC Sync to update the firmware manually. Not sure about transferring the prepaid number to T-Mobile, sorry.

As for their being horrible, find your nearest Device Support Center (ask at your local store) and become friendly with the manager. (And remember - AT&T does use independent dealers to open AT&T stores - and not all of them are on your side. Company store managers usually are.) TMobile is good, but they just don't have the coverage (and their little "unlimited data" trick is just that, a trick - you connect at full speed, then shift down to a lower speed, so things like Youtube are iffy.)

title: New update made files disapear when searching through a computer

thread.text:
After the latest android update. Whenever I plug my HTC One M9 into my computer to transfer files or photos too or from my computer, the folders where things are stored are now nowhere to be found. For example I had a folder I had titled Music and I put music into it. Well now whenever I click on the music folder nothing is in it, but on the phone the music is still there.
Here is another example. I have some photos on my phone id like to transfer to my computer. usually they would be in DCIM well they aren't there now. I browsed nearly every folder I could see on the phone but couldn't find them. I also have the option to see hidden files selected as well on my computer. Yet on the phone I can see them fine. When I go to the photos and look at it, and select details it says its called IMAG1275, and the file path is now /storage/5297-DD97/DCIM/100MEDIA I cannot find that on the files that show up on my computer anywhere at all. I used file explorer on the phone and it cant find it either. I also installed HTC sync manager and that cant find it either. Any idea what is going on? Or how I can find the file path through my computer? I have a bunch of photos id like to transfer and would rather not have to email them to myself 1-2 at a time.

replies.text:
Welcome to Android Central!
Did changing USB modes help?

thread.text: Welcome to Android Central! When you connect via USB, swipe down the notification panel and tap the USB icon. Make sure MTP is selected. Then check Windows Explorer. With Marshmallow, the default USB connection is Charge Only--you usually have to change it manually to MTP for the PC to recognize the phone's storage.

I am not entirely sure what you mean by MTP. I bring the drop down menu and select File transfers from the usb connection setting. Then it allows me to see most of the folders in my phone except the one im looking for. There is a folder in the phone called Mobile Content Transfer and while that does have a folder called storage in it. Its not the correct one. Sorry for the late response. I got pretty busy the last few days.

MTP means Media Transfer Protocol, and is often called File Transfer on certain phones--so it sounds like you have the correct setting.
Do the missing folders or files have a period in front of the name? Like "/.Documents"? In Windows Explorer, click on the options and make sure Show Hidden Folders/Files is turned on.
I have show hidden folders turned on. There is no period heres an example of the details from my phone of a pic on my phone I cant find on my comp /storage/5297-DD97/DCIM/100MEDIA

Are these files on the phone's Internal Storage or SD card?
What other options besides File Transfer do you have when you swipe the notification panel down?
Internal Storage. The options are Charging, File Transfers, Software Installation, Tethering, MIDI input, and MirrorLink Connection.
Hmm. Try reinstalling the USB drivers. I believe the HTC Sync Manager installer will do that: Download HTC Sync Manager

Same thing, doesn't matter if its in the sync manager or just through normal file explorer cant find the files. I might spend a day digging through every single file and see if I cant come up with something. I just doubt I will find it since a search for anything called storage already came up with nothing that I am looking for.
I should've asked this before--are you using a Windows PC or a Mac?

I use windows. 
Also i have a bit of an update. I didnt fully dig through every folder yet on the phones storage. But i started with the SD card and found out that it is saving new photos to the SD card in a seemingly random folder after digging around in there a bit.
Also I found out that the file path in the phone does not match up with a file path on a computer.
For example one says its in storage/emulated/0/restoreimage, while the computers file path is This PC\HTC6535LVW\Internal storage\RestoreImage
There is still an app i use which has some photos id like to save but cant find it yet. But again i havent dug through the entire phone yet. when i did a search for any of the folders listed in the details for those, none came up on the comp that had them. But i did a quick test and found i can copy those photos to the SD card in a new folder and find that folder. So that should work but is an annoying work around for something that used to be simple and easy prior to this new update.

The Camera app typically has a setting that allows you to choose where it will save photos by default (Internal Storage vs SD). What's yours set to?
Are you saying that when the Camera saves a photo, it saves to the RestoreImage directory instead of /DCIM/100Media? I'm not sure how to explain that. But I believe that the /storage/emulated/0/ directory is an artifact of how Android accesses its directory structure, and this isn't exactly how it's displayed when viewed through a PC. The PC is likely interpreting "/storage/emulated/0/" as "Internal Storage."

No i was using the restoreimage directory as an example of something i can see and how it reads the directories. 
I had a new update the other day again but it didnt fix the issue. In fact it seemed to make it worse. I went into the DCIM folder on the SD card tonight to grab a photo i had taken recently in which is where it should have been. Only to find out that its in a completely different DCIM folder now. I dug around and found a few other DCIM folders but none of them had the photo i needed so i had to email myself it. I only needed one photo at the time but there was a whole bunch that are now in some other folder i cant find once more.
I really would like to know what is going on and how to fix this. Its becoming more than just an annoyance at this point and would prefer not to factory reset the phone especially if i dont know if that will even set things right.
This might be getting too difficult to figure out remotely. I'm not sure how you have multiple DCIM folders, unless you're talking about multiple subfolders under the DCIM folder.
No there is litereally multiple DCIM folders and at least 1 I cannot find with more photos in it.

title: Is it worth now to buy m9?

thread.text: Im so conflicted right now to buy a new phone and seems like m9 is a good choice, is it still worth to buy it now? Im also consider other phone which is galaxy S6. I really need your opinion now, its a tough choice tbh.

I just got one last week, love it so far. The 6.0 update works well, I'm ending my days of moderate use with about 25% battery left. Its a good size, and gets comments from people when I take it out of my pocket with the dot view case. Because of its lack of hit factor, they are ridiculously cheap online, got mine brand new on ebay with warranty for $260 bucks. Such a great value.
If you don't need SD card support, I reckon the S6 is just as good if not better if you can get it for close to the same price, but I needed that functionality. Otherwise, the camera is not nearly as bad as some have reported, maybe its the updates, maybe its the tweaking of the image settings I did, I also use the raw camera quite a bit,. Selfies are awesome as well. The screen is fine, but I don't like the auto-brightness, it over compensates and I find it dim and washed out in many situations. I leave it on the middle brightness. 
Its also on track to get android 7.0, so its not out of date yet (although I imagine that's it for it, no 8.0)

If you don't mind buying an older phone I think it is. For what it's worth the M9 was my first android phone after switching from the 5s and I felt like it was good enough to keep me with android. I still have my M9, but I'm looking at possibly getting the new Nexus this fall. Also, the M9 still has an overheating problem in my experience. It probably won't be noticeable with normal use, but with some games (Pokemon GO) it definitely starts to heat up almost to an uncomfortable level. It doesn't happen THAT often, but it's something to keep in mind.

I have an M9 listed for trade, or sale $250, but I cannot find a worthy device. Thinking about raising my asking price to $300 as I don't really want to get rid of this "spare" phone.
The M9 runs strong, is stable and fast. Was listed as one of the more durable phones at the time. Great pocket size in Otterbox case.
I don't see very many M9 on Craigslist in my area. There are too many Samsung and iphone clones listed to take a chance on those. Also, the Sam S6 was not as durable, or water resistant , and no SD slot.
In my opinion, you cannot do much better than the M9 if you are looking to save some cash buying "last year's phone"
You shouldn't have to pay much more than $250 from a reputable seller.
Craigslist is not reliable, Please be careful and smart if you buy there. Study the ads carefully to find the "real" sellers and devices. Don't bother with any seller that removes their contact info from CL by spelling out their email in the body of the ad, those devices are stolen or clones.

I picked up one less then a month ago when TMO had them on sale for $299 for new ones. I couldnt pass that up. I had one a while back and also had an M8 so i sold the M9. Then later sold the M8 and realized i missed them. So i got another M9 for that stand by back up role. 
Im very glad i did. Been playing Pokemon Go on it ever since. I played 2 hours sunday morning in Down Town Dallas and didnt have any issues then went to a mall Monday and again had no issues. I dont feel it heats up any more then my Note 4 or other devices do. 
I think its a great device.

I'm also considering a M9. But I'm having a hard time making the decision. I've also been looking into the LG G4 (motherboard failure?) , & HTC A9 (slow processor?). I do know I love Sense UI compared to LG & any other manufacture skins. Also has anyone had premature battery & charging port failure? And has battery life improved since the marshmallow update?

thread.text: Sorry if i dont contribute to this thread. but i just need to know if the EIS works good while recording video on this device ?

I have had one for several months and hate it - the screens are just so unintuitive and difficult to manage. You can't turn off predictive text on the keyboard; you can't get rid of the rubbishy apps it comes with; the camera is awful in poor light or high contrast; e-mails delete themselves; alerts keep popping up and won't be turned off. BUT the hardware is good; it's fairly unbreakable - I have chucked mine across the room in frustration - whereas apple screens break as soon as you look at them. It picks up poor wifi signals better than apple and battery life is good.

I started using my M9 as a daily phone 3 weeks ago vs my Windows Phone 950XL, due to the app I need for work.
Heavy use, aprox 100+ Pics, with GPS location, constantly uploading over cellular, streaming music over BT while I work, with a screen on time of at least 1 1/2 hrs.
Uses my whole battery. If I goto an additional location, I have to use a battery pack.
I have to turn off WiFi while "mobile" as it interferes with both my cellular connection and BT or music playback.(not sure what the conflict is between WiFi and music over BT, but I have the same exact problem with the 950XL, so I don't think is is an OS or hardware issue)
Prior to my current daily use of the "spare" M9, the 950XL was my primary device with little more use than BT music. 
I needed the two in order to fulfil my device lust, but I think I am near the end of my "junkie" days as the excitement of what these devices can do now isn't the same as what it was in 2004.
Funny how adding a work element can take all the fun out of my "toys" and hobbies. Honestly, I never had to use a "device" specifically for "work" before.
The other pluses the M9(used $100) has over the 950XL(new $700), is accessories. I get dirty at work, I use an otter box, great feel and size in the hand, but the phone still gets filthy. I am not trashing my "new" 950XL.
Windows phone still rules in voice over BT. Hope Android catches up in that functionality soon.

title: HTC M9 not deleting music

thread.text:
Morning
I have deleted the music folders from my internal and external drive, so it does not show any albums, songs etc.
However when I go into Player Pro or the Music app there are still songs, artists albums listed.
There is no option to clear cache in either app.
Can anyone help ? 
Cheers in advance

Welcome to Android Central! Are the songs that the apps display the same ones you deleted, or are they left over?
To clear the app cache and data, are you going to Settings>Apps, selecting the music player, then tapping Storage, and then Clear Cache/Clear Data?

Many thanks
I have done that, but there are still albums and songs listed, when I try to play them it's an incompatible format.
Any other ideas ? 
Many thanks

But do you know if those remaining songs are ones you deleted using the file manager?
Keep in mind that the music app will show you any music files stored anywhere on the phone, as long as there isn't a ".nomedia" file in that same directory. This is why your Ringtones and Notifications usually show up in the music list as well. The songs or albums you're seeing might be related to some app, and therefore the files themselves may be in a directory associated with that app. Use your file manager app to look through all available directories and subdirectories for those songs (or use the search function in the file manager to look for the filenames). If your file manager doesn't have a search function, install a 3rd party one like Total Commander.

title: Internet connection unstable

thread.text: hey guys, I have an HTC One M9 android phone. I can't seem to connect to wifi without it saying "internet connection unstable." I tried restarting my phone, factory reset my phone still didn't work. Then I changed the phone name to HTC One still didn't work, I also wiped the phone Cache and that didn't do the trick. Updated my phone to Android 6.0 still nothing. Reset the wifi modem still didn't work. Changed the Frequency to 2.4 Ghz from 5 Ghz, nope nothing still. I also tried switching from DHCP to static and that didn't help. Finally I installed two apps "1Tap wifi repair" and "WiFi Connection Fixer" and they both tell me they've successfully repaired the wifi and still have the same problem. I kind of don't know what else to do. Any more options would be helpful. If you have any thoughts on what it might be please let me know. Thanks in advanced

replies.text:
First of all uninstall those 2 apps they do nothing. Except fill your phone full of useless crap.
Second. Do you have "Smart Network Switch" on? In your Wifi settings? This is the worst thing ever created.
It switches between Wifi and Mobile to get the best connection, yet even with WIFI is amazing it still thinks it's not
If it's on DISABLE IT!
Turn on your HTC One M9 and HTC One M9 Plus smartphone
Enable the mobile data connection of the HTC One M9.
After the mobile data connection is enabled, go to Menu -> Settings -> Wireless.
At the start of the page you will see the option “Smart network switch”.
Uncheck this option to obtain a not so stable wireless connection of your HTC One M9 with the router still upright.
Now your HTC One M9 will no longer automatically switch between Wi-Fi and the mobile internet.
If that does work. Do you have a Modem Router all in one combo from a provider like Comcast or Roadrunner? These are awful, awful, awful!
If that is the case I would contact your ISP and see what they are screwing up.
Oh and stay away from the 5Ghz stick with 2,4
Let me know if you get any results

thread.text: Moderator Note - Please respect the prior warnings. There are not going to be any further warnings in this thread.

A phone shouldn't get hot enough to crack it, that is an indication of a problem. That doesn't mean a phone won't get hot enough to crack a screen. 
My Note 3 started heating up badly, it would spike up to 135 degrees. When I called Samsung, they wanted me to send it in immediately. When it got there, it did have a camera lens crack, which was covered by warranty. That wasn't the screen, but the phone didn't get super hot. When I talked to Samsung, they told me if it continued getting hotter and hotter, at best I would end up with a cracked screen, at worst a burned up phone. 
My phone had a motherboard that went bad and was causing it to heat up. It just hadn't gotten hot enough to crack my screen. So yes it could happen, should it happen? No, that is an indication of a problem with the glass or an internal issue causing the phone to truly overheat not just running a little hot.

While the lock screen stuff can be disabled in blinkfeed settings... you cant remove Yelp from the blinkfeed easily. This is how to kill Yelp, and probably all future ads: 
1) Make sure you have the new Sense widget where you can choose - 'Work, Home or Out'. If you don’t have it on any homescreen, then add it. (You can remove it after)
2) Click on the word 'Work, Home or Out' and then click on the three menu dots on the right.
3) Select 'Personalize HTC Sense Home'
4) Untick 'Share My Precise Location' and 'Share My Personal Usage Data'
5) Remove the Sense Home Widget if you’d like.
6) No more Yelp! (This should not affect your location for weather, or maps, or anything else)

title: Htc m9 stopped seeing micro sd card

thread.text: This happened 2 days ago while taking a video. My phone didn't take any damage or fall. While taking a photo it said SD card was unmounted and stopped shooting. I tried SD card with another phone and it worked perfect however the video was corrupted I think. What do you suggest? I tried restarting phone bunch of times.

Welcome to Android Central! The card is probably either corrupt or counterfeit. A counterfeit card is one that is smaller capacity, but programmed to report a larger capacity. It works fine until you exceed the true capacity, after which things start to be glitchy with the data on it. Use SD Insight to check if your card is valid.
If the card is valid, then unmount it (in Settings>Storage), remove it, and insert it into your computer. Run chkdsk to look for bad sectors: http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...d-sd-card.html

My phone is doing the same thing, but with two sd cards now. They work in my computer and my tablet but not my phone. I took my phone to Sprint and they said it was because my card wasn't fast enough, even though they're both class 10. I'm glad I'm not the only one this is happening to, it's twice now in 2 months.

Also, I used the SD Insight app which told me the card is valid, and I did the chkdsk and both are fine. But my phone still acts like there's not an SD card installed. I'd rather not buy a third card since I'm fairly sure this will happen again. Is there any further info on this?

replies.text: Can you make any changes in your SD card? Deleting or adding a file to it? In my case I couldn't change a single thing in SD card, it was in self-protect mod and frozen. My laptop could see what was in it but couldn't make any changes.

Please, guys. You're better than this. He hasn't got an AC Forums account yet, but I told him that if he wants to explain his issue firsthand, then he could.

The phone did throttle, as you put it. Look at your last screen shot. You said your friend had it on the charger all night yet it is only 47% charged. This means the phone detected the heat and quit drawing amperage like it is supposed to. The fact that it continued to overheat, despite the charging circuitry of the phone being shut down, would point to the charger as a likely culprit. Sometimes chargers go bad or occasionally, they malfunction. I have had chargers overheat my phone. I have had chargers drain my phone, instead of charging them, and then work fine afterwards. It may or may have not been the chargers fault, but I would remain leery of it.

Phew, finally. An answer I was looking for. 
He used both the stock HTC charger and one for the Shield Tablet. It hasn't got hot until now. 
Maybe it's best we get a new charger along with a replacement M9. Seems like the charger might be the culprit since the M9 hasn't really overheated in daily use for most users.

title: Long term HTC One M9 owners- thoughts on the device?

thread.text: I'm considering buying one in a few months ($450 new, or $350 used with T-Mobile right now), but reviews have either made it seem really, really good, or really, really bad. Does it still perform well, does it heat up as bad as people say (if it runs cooler than the Exynos 5433, all will be good. That thing will burn a man), and is the battery decent? Basically, how is it with things of that degree (no pun intended), as well as any other additional things you may have to say/think about it?

I've already purchased one off ebay, but I'm finding the same thing in the reviews. Some say the battery is fantastic, some say it is abysmal. Some people review it as getting scorching hot, some say it doesn't heat up any more than other phones. Hopefully since this has been out for quite some time firmware updates have helped the issues a lot. Which some reviewers seem to state. I'd imagine most reviews we are reading are on pre release or just after launch units.
Hopefully that's the case, though reviews on the T-Mobile website seem just as mixed. If you get it soon, try and let me know how it is if possible, please.

Having the most recent firmware / software on it will help you a lot. I have a M8, M9, Note 4 and Nexus 6. If it wasnt for the display being weak / washed out i would probably use it as my daily driver. On paper the M8 and M9 are supposed to have the same screen but its clear to me that the M8 has a better screen. I think to conserve battery they are using adaptive brightness to much. On manual brightness with screen trurned up a bit i like it. 
As far as battery life and over heating I have no issues with that. But my usage and your usage im sure will be different. 
I think its a great device but i was let down with the display. Thats my only complaint. Im looking forward to Marshmallow on it.

I'll post back when I get it Hitokage. Should be late this week. 
I hope the screen is a little more vibrant than the lg g3 which I have now. That's another thing I find mixed in the reviews. Some say it is a fantastic screen on the M9, others say it isn't that great. Of course they usually mention the S6 QHD amoled as comparison. I certainly don't expect it to look that over saturated. Don't care about the resolution at 5", Full HD is fine, but the g3 is known for being a bit washed out, poor contrast etc. so if it's better than that, I'll be happy.

The screen is good if you choose to manually adjust the brightness. 
Oh also during the last update or two, they added in a software feature to set the screen to cool or warmer colors. I liked this feature as i set mine to the warmer side. The cooler side to me made white look a bit bluish.

The biggest problem with the M9 is that it was such a minor upgrade from the M8 which is still a great phone. The Galaxy probably has the better camera but, for a phone, the M9 takes fine pictures. I think too much was made of the alleged camera issue. Per GSAM, I average around 20 hours on a full charge but I'm always near a charger (home, work, car) and almost always on WIFI so my results may not be typical. Overheating was a minor issue at first (with me, it only happend when out in the scorching sun) but I think they have fixed that with the last software update.  Performance is great - no lag whatsoever - and Sense is still a great skin. I considered the Galaxy before buying the M9 but just can't get past the abomination that is TouchWIz.
EDIT: my only lasting complaint with the phone is the over-aggressive "auto-brightness" but you can just turn that off if you like. I hope they fix that with the Marshmallow rollout.

Good thing I normally set brightness myself. Looks like I'll be getting one of these soon, then. Is there any disadvantage for getting it used from T-Mobile rather than new from T-Mobile, other than it potentially having scratches?

Wifi disconnects or fails to connect sometimes, and camera sucks at times. However, wifi generally works all right and camera in manual mode is awesone.
Battery is great at 38% brightness and with no games. Gotta admit, you won't get the best gaming experience on this because power saver makes the game lag a bit and mid brightness with no power saver makes the phone a bit hot. (0% brightness does the job right!)
But in everyday experience, it never lags and I usually get 2 to 3 days out of one charge.
Overall, great phone.
Posted via the Android Central App

When I was researching the HTC devices, I too would read very conflicting reviews. "The battery life is great!" vs "It's... Average" were disconcerting. Also, reviewers seem to be on the fence about the camera; but again, there are reviewers saying "it's decent" and some saying "it's not that great."
As other users here have said, a lot of those reviews were done pre-launch or when the devices just came out; so I wouldn't worry too much about the heating/battery life, etc. I would suggest going to your carrier's website and seeing if there are any customer reviews on the M9 - I did this with Rogers when I was deciding between which phone to get, and it really helped. Of course, you get some pointless reviews saying absolutely nothing; but then you can get an enormous paragraph detailing a clear, intelligent review of the device. Good luck!

Ok, my phone arrived yesterday. The phone did heat up a bit initially, before OS updates. It had two updates and downloaded 200 apps in succession. A 45 minute OS update and then another 30 min OS update. Both ran warm but nothing I would ever take note of by any means. So far today I've been downloading lots of other stuff and playing with it a lot, gaming etc. It hardly gets warm. I'm not a power user though, but it's no worse than my lg g3 is, in fact, it may run a bit cooler. 
Cant say much about battery life yet but it does charge slower than my G3 on a standard charger. Initially the battery seems to be holding up fine considering how much I've been using it. It's been off charge for 5 hours 15 minutes and I'm at 68%. Considering I've had the screen on for a considerable amount of that time, bluetooth to a moto360, wifi on and downloading and installing or updating about 30 apps while gaming, changing settings etc. etc. General brand new phone set up stuff. I'd say it's holding up well. Under a normal mornings usage I doubt I'd be down even 10%.
Screen is an upgrade IMO compared to the G3, despite the resolution advantage of the G3. Blacks are slightly blacker and colours are more saturated. Obviously not amoled good. But an improvement. 
Over all I'm pretty optomistic and haven't experienced any of the downfalls noted in the "bad" reviews.
I'm not a fan. Got this a week after it was released. Battery life is horrid, gets hotter than a witches tit with a brass bra in the summer time and often lags. My Note 3 is faster, it seems.

replies.text: Have you updated it? Mine has no heat, no lag, and is quick. Battery life is decent , depending on network strength, and a bit better after M.....

thread.text: If you are having battery problems or heating issues then you need to enter recovery mode and wipe the device's system cache. There are several how to's online including a complete google response to the correct question. It takes 2 minutes... Hold Power and vol down after shutting down the phone. Enter recovery. Hold power and vol up after you see the red triangle with the ! in the middle and you will get the factory reset or wipe cache screen. The vol rockers change the selection and the power button is enter. After System cache wipe, then reboot. All of your problems will be gone and you don't lose any data or system settings. You should always perform this on any phone after OS update or after you are done setting it up from the box new

replies.text: Is this method also for unrooted phones?

This method is for all HTC phones. All HTC phones have a recovery (stock and rooted, whereas a rooted phone has a "custom recovery").
From me to you by the Power Cosmic

thread.text:
Hi guys,
I have had my M9 since launch in Canada last year in March I believe. I have used it normally, doing all updates. For the last month or two, the battery will not last me even 3 or 4 hours. I will not touch it, no apps are draining my battery as I barely use any. My data and wifi will be turned off, and it will just drain.
This morning I unplugged it at 7am. Did not even look at the phone, and at 8am it sat at 81%. Since 8am I have left the phone on Extreme Power Saver, and took it off after a couple hours to use some apps. It now sits at 47% (1247pm).
Doing almost nothing with the phone. This is what happens on a daily basis. I have turned off location services, wifi searching, everything I could find and nothing helps. I called HTC and they basically guided me through turning the phone on and off a few times through the boot screen, then allowing it to charge. That did nothing to help.
Does anyone have an answer for me of what this issue is? Should I take it to my local repair shop for a new battery? Should I just replace the phone? I was looking at the G4.
Never Herd Of This Before. It May Be Due To A Faulty Battery Or Overcharging. If I Were You And You Wanted To Keep The Phone Get The Battery Replaced.

replies.text: How would overcharging have anything to do with it? I thought phones were protected from overcharging.

thread.text:
just because your not using the phone doesnt mean an app isnt messed up and running rouge. 
Hard reset it, set it up, use it normally, if problem is still there then it might be a battery issue. 
Does your phone get warm when not in use?

Try booting into Safe Mode, and with a 100% charge just let it sit for the rest of the day and then examine the battery information - if you're still having a problem where it's close to being dead by the end of the day then you likely have a hardware issue.

I am having the same problem as well almost to a "T". After talking to Verizon for three days of this they sent me a new phone. Turned it on logged into google then the phone updated all the apps while on wifi and charger. Afterward even in safe mode and plane mode turned on the phone drains about 5% every 10 - 15 min.
Really making the phone almost usless not holding a charge for more then two or three hours!

I was having the same problem to the point where the battery in my M9 was actually impacted and I was given a new phone. As soon as I got it restored, the battery drain started again. I decided that it had to be some kind of rogue memory drain.
I downloaded an app that told me what was using my memory and everything was really minimal except Cloud & Kindle. They were both duking it out and keeping the memory fluctuating a a high rate of consumption back and forth. I disabled both apps and my phone has been behaving absolutely brilliantly with an amazing battery life since.

replies.text: May you please share this app I'm having the same issues.

thread.text:
I'm having the same exact problem with an M9 on Verizon. About a month ago (late May, early June) my phone just started overheating and draining the battery for no apparent reason. It will routinely drain about 50-60% during my 2 hour commute each morning. While I'm at work it's plugged into the USB port on my computer at work and will slow charge through the day. When I leave work I'm usually at 100% and I'll see the same % drain on the commute home. On the weekends I'm not tethered to a desk and the phone will routinely be dead by the time we're looking to eat lunch. Verizon says they didn't do anything, must be hardware, HTC support says it's probably a software update that Verizon pushed out. (pause to pull hair out) I've read forums all over the place and I'm finally starting to see other posts complaining of the same symptoms starting around the same time so I'm starting to think it's s software issue, but I've yet to pinpoint which apps are doing it. I installed GSAM battery monitor and will post my findings back here but if anyone has any ideas that worked for them, I'm willing to try them. Thanks!
EDIT: In the time it took me to write this (5 minutes on my computer) my phone was sitting on the desk with the screen off and lost 11%. WTF?!?
It's called OS Monitor. Good luck.

replies.text: How did you check the memory usage within the app I do not see the option.

thread.text:
OMG, I've been searching for a month for people having the same issue!!!! I've been on 5 support chats with HTC and sent in for repair. Nothing has fixed the issue. My phone is around 100F-115F.
I've found the following via OS Monitor (Process > Tool Icon > Paragraph Icon > Memory) and I have the following apps sucking around 50% of the RAM.
Google PLay Store 165 MB
SwiftKey Keyboard 152 MB
Google PLay Services 148 MB
Sense Home 142 MB
Google Account Manager 137 MB
Google Play Music 117 MB
Facebook 114MB
and a couple more

title: How do I reboot an HTC One M9 AT&T Android Phone?

thread.text: data will not enable on my htc one mp phone, i need to know how to get this to work properly.

Welcome to Android Central! To reboot, just hold the Power button until you see the Power menu. Then tap Power Off (or Restart, if available).
When you say that data won't enable, are you talking about 3G/4G data? Are you using it on AT&T, and if so, have you spoken to them about this? They might want to try a different SIM card, or help you check your APN settings.

title: Turn off Caller ID by Google?

thread.text:
My 5 month old M9 lost the will to live, so Verizon sent me a new one.
This new one seems to have Caller ID by Google(?) turned on by default.
I cannot begin to express how much I hate this feature. I want my unknowns to come in as Unknown. However, I can find no place to turn this off. 
Running stock Android 6 (I swear my last phone was something like 6.01, but Update says I am up to date) from Verizon (I'm using Nova Launcher, but I can't think that would have anything to do with it).
Any suggestions would be appreciated. This is genuinely enough to make me consider buying a new phone at retail.
Thanks/k

replies.text:
Seems like the option is gone. You might want to send HTC a tweet, let them know you're a little disappointed, and move elsewhere if it's that annoying.
Wish I had better news - sorry.

thread.text: Caller ID settings are usually done through the carrier, such as a keypad code entered through the phone.
Yeah, that's what I was afraid of. I am getting more used to seeing the names instead of Unknown, but I still prefer the old way.

It is not by Google. Carriers usually have a deal with certain software maker to promote the special caller id feature baked into the carrier phone as part of bloatware. It will be on the new phone activated for a week or so. Then, it will either auto-disable itself or if you want to keep the feature, you will have to pay a monthly fee to use it.

title: What does a 'G' data icon mean?

thread.text:
traveling fronm Colorado to Texas, I saw this icon on the data section of the phone. It's a 'G'.

Steve

title: Custom Rom Ruined EVERYTHING!

thread.text:
Hey Guys I need help ASAP!!
Okay well I rooted my phone ages ago and everything was fine! untill vodafone finally released an update and then i instantly wanted to upgrade so after giving up on a way to flash the OTA update (because vodafone dons't release them for manual installation) I decided to flash a custom rom with android 6.0 It all flashed okay and thep hone booted up fine but after a realised a few MAJOR problems occursed
1: Anything that uses moving pictures dosn't load so no youtube video's or FB videos (all just say please try again)
2: No games at all, all crashes to desktop
3: No recorded video it just fails
4: can't call anyone it just hangs on the call screen
Tried flashing other custom roms Viper, Android HD, Cyanogen mod all of them have the exact same issue.. i'm beggining to go mad. I'd appreciate ANY help you can provide. thanks guys
Welcome to the forums. Did you do a reset when you flashed the custom ROM?
I've tried restarting and flashing other roms clearning cashes etc :/ its odd having the same issue's using similar apps over different roms :/

Nevermind guys... got help from an unlikely source 
Apparently its a bad idea to update your rom without updating your firmware first (didn't know they were separate)
Updated that and now everything is running smoothly

Camera much better in low light pics as well.

This is a big issue that many of us are having. Just go the XDA forums..
I have found that a reboot before charging helps, but this cannot be the solution. HTC fix this! In the meantime I went back to my iPhone 6. I cannot rely on my M9 for anything. Two nights in a row and after 7 hours plugged in the M9 was not fully charged!
Sometimes it says it needs 16 hours to fully charge..Most of the time it's ready after 6-7 hours.
I do not want to make a plan every day when I charge my phone. Back to the iPhone for now..
My M9 phone from 30% to full charge approx 2 hrs

Same issue with my device: often charges only 10% per hour.
I checked with various monitoring apps, and the actual charging current tops about 0.3 A, not even close to the theoretical 1.5 amps of the factory charger, so no surprise in the charging time. Tits. With these current levels, I would be not surprised at all, if using the phone while charging resulted in no charging at all, or even discharging, as many apps easly drain 0.5 millimamps. It has been driving me mad for the last couple of days, I have checked half a dozen chargers and cables alike in every combinations, when I have read about certain "thermail improvements" during charging in the last software update. I guees these jerks crippled the charging current so not to overheat the phone. Very nice!
I am soooooo disappointed in this device. I could have lived with the on-release genious "software fix" of the thermal issues when putting high load on the phone, as I dont care about benchmarks and rarely use performance heavy apps. But fking up my charging time to 9 hours takes the cake!
I also presume, since the thermal issues are of hardware origin, they can not do much about it, but restrict hardware performance whenever related to heat (CPU clock speed, charging current, etc), or recall all devices, no biggie.
Here ya go! http://thedroidguy.com/2015/06/how-t...heating-108030
Can't help ya, but good luck!

Wiping the cache partition also doesn't help.

First they delivered a firmware that wasn't ready. Overheating, bad camera quality..
Then they solved most camera issues (Kudos to them) and destroyed the way the device charges. That wasn't enough though, they brought ads to BlinkFeed, my favorite feature of Sense.
Goodbye HTC. I hope to see you again when you start making sense again. You are the disappointment of the year

The phone charges fast to completion, but if I leave it on the charger overnight, I see it can be anywhere from 60% - 90% charged in the morning. HTC has a Verizon firmware update higher than the one that is now on my phone which I downloaded, but I have thus far been unsuccessful at getting it to install. If anyone else has seen this problem and has fixed it, please let me know. This phone was perfect until the damned update.

Last night my toddler woke me up at 3 AM when I checked my phone, I got a warning that my phone was issuing more battery them the charger could handle. I went to bed with 46% and woke up with 17%. Becuase if its locked to a carrier, it could be the bloatware the carrier has installed into the rom

I'm not sure if everyone has given up on this topic or not, but I thought I would chime in given that I have been experiencing the same issues. Firstly, the phone overheats like crazy - but only sometimes. It did this before I even installed any apps so I know that if it is a software problem it is HTC's software problem, not mine. Unfortunately I am the one who has to deal with it. It doesn't happen always, but the phone does stay much warmer than any other device I've had and quite honestly I'm surprised it hasn't given itself heatstroke. Seriously, the fact that it can withstand its own heat problem soeaks to the heartiness of the rest of the phone. Not an acceptable problem to allow a device to be released with. Seriously HTC, get your *** together before you release your product. I also know that if it was a hardware problem it is a hardware problem for all (or at least most) HTC One m9 users. I know this because as soon as I noticed the heat issue I sent it back and got a replacement which had the same problem PLUS a charging problem. So I sent that one back, too and the newest one was working fine. Then one day it started having the same problems. It would get so hot and it was charging extremely slowly. If I was using it while it was charging the battery pecentage would still drain - slowly but it was going down. I would have returned it again if it hadn't been such a good phone otherwise. So I hung on to it and have spend a lot of time scouring the internet looking for solutions. Then HTC released a software update that was supposed to fix charging and overheating problems. That worked for about 3 days. Arg. So now I have a phone that regularly gets very hot and about 1/6th of the time charges incredibly slowly. There is nothing wrong with the port or the cable. I am using a rapid charge HTC charger. I have tried different cables and ports but it doesnt make a difference. I have always had trouble getting it to onnect to my Windows 7 machine - every time I hook it up I have to go to the device manager and uninstall the device (not just the drivers) and reinstall it and then it reads fine. But that is a different issue - I am pretty sure it is just a driver problem - the lady with HTC chat told me not to install their sync program under any circumstances (which I hadn't done anyways). Just thought I would throw that out there while we were discussing fixes for the problems people are having with this model. So, its not the charger, the cable, the port, the apps, the version...I have done a soft reset,a couple of hard resets (yay I get to install everything all over again) and I just recalibrated the battery. I'm not expecting too much but hey, let's see if it is at least a temporary fix. It is too late for me to return the phone now and if I could just solve this set of battery/charging issues I'll be really happy. I'm on a mission - if anyone has anymore suggestions please post them or feel free to email me at klear6@hotmail.com Thanks for your time. You are not alone and I hope this info has helped you not waste too much time on suggested fixes that don't really help.

title: Does the HTC One M9 still have battery issues?

thread.text:
Hey guys, i am looking into buying a new phone before the weekend, and the HTC One M9 is a phone i am thinking of getting.
The HTC design, build quality, high definition audio, speaker quality, decent camera, great software and processor performance are things that are swaying me towards an HTC phone.
However, i have been reading reviews, and the biggest complaint is by far the extremely poor battery on it. This, unfortunately is quite a large negative.
My question to anyone who has experience with HTC and owns one of these phones is this...Since the phones release, has their been any updates dealing with the battery issue, prolonging battery life on the phone?
Has the later version of Android 6.0 solved the battery issue?
Also final question, being an octa core phone, why is the battery so bad in the M9, when they specifically made the phone octa core with 4 lower powered cores to give the phone good battery management... i.e using the low powered cores for low intensive use such as browsing the web, and 4 high powered cores which kick in for high intensive use such as a very graphic intensive game. Is it that the M9 just needs a larger capacity battery, or is it purely contributed to poor software tuning for the battery and processors?
Cheers,
Matt

If you plan on rooting the phone, youre almost 100% sure of getting between 4-5 hrs of SOT with the correct tweaks like greenify, naptime and some kernel tweaks. All this w/o losing any performance. Right now im at 84% left with 1,20 hrs of SoT.

To be honest, i would more than likely not be rooting the phone.
So i guess without a root the phone has a terrible battery life? I was hoping HTC may of fixed that with updates, but i guess not? What a shame. Everything about the phone is almost perfect, and the poor battery life really lets it down imo.

replies.text: i was not rooted the first months of using the phone and got between 4-5:30 hrs of SOT. Id recommend buying the 10 if youre able or a S7 edge. The battery life on the M9 is average - good, but other phones are better.
I'm not rooted and I'm lucky to get 2.5-3 hours SOT. What settings helped you accomplish this? I mostly web browse and I'm mostly out & about

thread.text: Yeah the 10 is far superior in every way, other than the design imo. Unfortunately, the HTC 10 is not available in New Zealand.

Are you using a screen protector? If so, it is very likely the problem.

thread.text:

replies.text: Have you found a fix? I've been rebooting fairly often, which seems to prevent the issue for a while.

thread.text: I'll try that when it acts up. I wonder if this is a more general problem? Perhaps an instance of this issue:https://productforums.google.com/for...us/oqh-V37hgDM

To check the proximity sensor operation without using a 3rd party app you can simply make a phone call, then hold the phone next to your face (at which point the screen should turn off) and then move it away from your face (and the screen should turn back on).
If this isn't working reliably reboot into Safe Mode and do the same test - this will eliminate interference from any 3rd party apps. If a problem still exists then a Factory Reset is in order - if that fails to correct the issue then you have a hardware problem.
As the earlier poster noted, it's very common to have a poorly aligned screen protector cause this kind of issue, but since you don't have that or a case the rest of the troubleshooting is necessary.

title: Process of com.gapps.google (or what ever it said) has stopped working... And so has sense home.

thread.text: Last month, I unlocked my phone and this loop popped up saying com.google.process.gapps has stopped. I could get around to settings and then I tried doing all the stuff I saw, clearing all of the app cache and download stuff and all that crap. When I figured out what the message meant, it meant that Google play services where not working correctly. So guess what, I disabled it in apps and the message went away. So it has nothing to do with downloads it's 100% google play related. So I couldn't figure out a way to fix it, the window was just gone, which bought me some time but really couldn't get anywhere. --- I reset my phone. About a month later (now) I knew something was up when my screen changed when I opened it. It says "Sense home has stopped unexpectedly. Would you like to send a report?" Right then I remembered sense home was home screen. So I sent a report wouldn't even let me. Then I got the com.google.process.gapps thing again now I don't know where to turn. I turned off Google Play Services to do what ever I need to do I can still get into settings, but I don't want to reset it again. I've had my phone for about a year and 2 weeks. Never been rooted. Please help. I don't want to reset it.  P.S. Mobile Data isn't working at all like its not filled at all no bars where I normally have LTE. I did something I can't remember, but I held down the power button and the down button I think and it brought me to a screen with a red triangle and an exclamation mark.

Are you running the current firmware? If not you might want to consider loading that.
And just do whatever you need to do to backup your content so that you can perform a Factory Reset.
Yeah, it won't let me do a backup, I tried it already. It needs google.
Yeah, it won't let me do a backup, I tried it already. It needs google to work.

There are other ways to backup things like your Contacts, SMS, etc.
MyBackup Pro https://play.google.com/store/apps/d...id.MyBackupPro (there's also a free version)
SMS Backup & Restore https://play.google.com/store/apps/d...SBackupRestore
You can also export your Contacts to a csv file if you don't want to mess with installing apps.
Of course the real solution is to find out why Google services is crashing and fix that problem. Having an Android device without Google services is like - well, it's like having an Amazon device.

Actually there are plenty pic for such M9, e.g. http://www.phonesreview.co.uk/wp-con...evisited-c.jpg. Seems to be from non-US versions which could still be used in US.
From the pics of it, it seems to be machined perfect to HTC standard. I doubt it will be fake but you don't buy stuff like that from someone you don't know and have no recourse to return it if it is not what it looks like. Try eBay which gives you automatic protection.
Also, install apps to check processor used inside the phone. If it is Qualcomm processor, it is real. No fake phones can afford to use Qualcomm processors (majority of Chinese made phones use non-Qualcomm processors).

I frequently trade on CL.
Most of the clones seem to be Samsung and iphone. Most clones were bought on eBay.
Think about how popular the device is, and how likely it is to be cloned.
You are probably going to be safe with HTC.
The real worry is, was it stolen, was it not paid off and the carrier is going to blacklist it? Was the screen replaced? Did it get wet and hasn't died yet? Was it rooted or jailbroken, thus making it ineligible for OTA update?
I always run an IMEI check. Also check the "About" software, does it have a red "Modified" line? Look at the water indicators, and test with a SIM card.
Make sure the cloud lock is released.
If the seller is trying to rush away and won't wait for you to check it out, or meet in a safe public place or carrier store...REDFLAG!

title: Will remote wipe work on my stolen phone if I change my google password first?

doney84

Good question!
Hope your phone was locked with a "pin". And your "stuff" was backed up.
Had I stolen your phone, If I had the time, I would have tried to access it. Check out your pics, and music, maybe look at your messages to "see who you are".
If it wasn't locked, I assume I would need to know your Google PW to change your account PW.
Next I would turn it off and remove the SIM & memory cards and try to factory reset, First through the OS, If not asked for a PW, Then maybe through Recovery.
If I am successful, I would try to sell it, hopefully before it gets blacklisted.
So try to remote wipe, couldn't hurt. Report it stolen, wherever you can.
Does Swappa have a "report" button?
Good luck. Buyer beware!

thread.text:

thread.text: Which version of OS are you running on? In Android 5.xx, there is a sleep mode in battery manager. In Android 6.0, there is a doze mode. Both do the same thing, turn off data and sync when the phone idles for too long.

I'm on 6.0
Where should I look and disable?
Google for it. There are plenty of topics about it. It is the new feature of Android 6.0 OS, not specific for M9. Don't have 6.0 on my M9 yet.

thread.text: Is there still no solution for this available?
Are you using Wi-Fi or cellular data during the time that the device is asleep? If Wi-Fi, be sure you have it set to always remain connected while sleeping.

replies.text: Yes this is enabled, I already checked this. I'm using WIFI.

thread.text:
Well, you could try turning WiFi off one night and see if Gmail acts as it should - if it does you'll at least be sure it has something to do with the WiFi configuration or Doze feature.
Of course you did a Factory Reset after the update to 6.x?
I did, didn't help at all. This is doze it's unbeliavable that this can't be fixed. The other night I left it on charger and then it works normally...

I don't see anywhere that you can modify Doze settings, and if it did this immediately after a Factory Reset then I can only assume you didn't fiddle with Battery Saver or Battery Optimization settings.
I'd try the shotgun approach:
1. Restart the phone immediately before going to bed and see if the problem still occurs
2. If that doesn't make any difference, reboot into Safe Mode immediately before going to bed and see if the problem still occurs
If all else fails, plug the phone in before going to bed and wait for the next OS update
If Doze is having an effect, there should be an option to whitelist it under battery optimization settings. Look in Settings>Battery>menu.

Reading a bit about Doze. Here are my findings:
1. Doze can't be turned off. But you can create application exceptions for individual applications.
2. Doze only kicks in when you are not touching the phone AND not plugged in.
3. When doze kicks in, network access will be blocked and delayed. 
So, the simple solution to OP is simply plug in to AC charge when you go to bed. If you already doing that, it is not the problem caused by Doze mode. GMail always has its own mind, in my past experience, and Google never let you modify or change sync options (push or manual or scheduled poll).

title: Which are the SAR levels for the HTC One M9 ?

thread.text:
Hallo,
I would like to ask:
Which are the right SAR levels (values), for the HTC One M9, on head and on body, for the EU (European) Model OPJA100 and for the US (USA) Model OPJA120.
I have thoroughly searched. Findings are:
0.369 W/kg (body) / 0.518 W/kg (head). Source: http://www.cnet.com/uk/products/htc-one-m9-review/specs/ 
0.35 W/Kg Body SAR (USA), 0.56 W/kg Head SAR (USA). Source: http://www.devicespecifications.com/en/model-sar/76aa318f
These SAR values, are very close: 0.369 is close to 0.35, and, 0.518 is close to 0.56. This is not quite normal. Almost always these values are quite different, because the SAR measurement process is different between Europe and USA. It is W/kg@10g and W/kg@1g, accordingly. 
Thank you in advance.

If so, the next time this happens, go to the Battery menu and see if there is an app that is using an unusually high percentage of battery.

title: Underrated?

thread.text:
Do any of you feel that the M9 is underrated? I think it's an awesome device. I seriously have no complaints about it. It does everything that I need it to do very well, and never lags. I even get good shots with the camera. 
Just wanted to throw that out there.

replies.text: I think after this update and all the other work they've done on this phone, its really nice now, and highly under rated. I'm gonna be very happy...until the M-10 comes out.

thread.text:
I find it ridiculous that the M9 was bashed so hard by media, reviewers and consumers for being an evolution of the previous versions. Most people said HTC took an "if it ain't broke, don't fix it approach" and that was a horrible decision and it may kill them. 
However, all I hear about the new S7 is how fantastic it is that they just evolved the device rather than revolutionized it. That they took the right approach with "if it ain't broke, don't fix it" and making an iteration of the S6.
Soooo, HTC make a positive evolution of a great device and it is bashed, Samsung makes a positive evolution of a great device and it is praised. I don't get it.

replies.text:
Welcome to the land of Android hypocrisy and double standard. Prime example, look at the reaction to the S7 bringing back the SD Card vs when HTC brought the feature back into its lineup. Yes, a lot of editors and commenters have had disdain for HTC ever since the M9 didn't live up to the renders shown prior to. Luckily here at AC they are very impartial about every device they review. HTC will never be given a fair shake as far as I'm concerned.
Posted via the Android Central App

When/if they get the camera right on the HTC10 they will build up a lot of consumer equity going forward. Also, they can't release beta software as a finished product. The phone was fine after several firmware/software updates but most people don't have the patience for that. It's their own fault.

I'm not a Samsung fan in anyway, but I think the S7 is being given a pass by so many critics because it's pretty much what the S6 should've been. Sd card and water resistance are back, and those were the main pain points of the S6.
I came to the the M9 from a G3, so the quality of the M9 is crystal clear to me. I honestly think the M9 would have gotten a pass as well if HTC had knocked it out of the park with the camera.
Posted via the Android Central App

Yes I think he's right. Get the basics right and the phone is a winner. Put some extra features in and the phone is a classic piece of hardware. S7 this time did exactly that. Last year they refined the design. This year they completed the package with the basics and the extra features. 
I've used both m8 and the m9. And honestly, the screen, the battery life and the camera were better on the m8 than the m9. You may disagree. I still love both phones as built quality and design are my first priority in owning a phone plus Sense is the best android skin out there. Having said that, this was my experience. 
M8s screen was way more vibrant and alive. The battery life was very very good. And though mp count was low it took some great photos. 
M9 screen is a little faded away. The battery life isn't that good. And the photos are...ummmmm well, the same. But it has so much potential. Just the software puts it down. 
And also, with everyone in 2015 trying to go bezel less. I was hoping they'd do the same. But they came up with the same massive bezels. 
So the basics; camera battery screen and design (bezels) didn't appeal to me. And I only used the phone for a month then changed. I won't say which one I'm using now because people go crazy. I'm just going to say that I love it. 
And if the 10 gets screen battery and camera right, I'm going back.
Posted via the Android Central App

title: Cant edit personal dictionary

thread.text:
It seems i cant edit words in my personal dictionary on my HTC One m9. The option doesnt show up, i just bought the phone about 2 weeks ago.
I Just want to edit my dictionary for faster texting like I had on my HTC One m7.

replies.text:
This only works if you are using Sense Keyboard: 
Go to Settings, and then tap Language & keyboard > HTC Sense Input.
Tap Personal dictionary.
To edit a word, tap the item in the list.
To delete items from the dictionary, tap > Delete. Select the words you want to remove, and then tap Delete.

thread.text: Does the phone really have to be laying flat for doze to work properly?

replies.text: I think the key is it can not be moving. Set on a table it will doze but not in your pocket.

This is silly. Google think they're so clever. So if the phone is in my pocket and I'm not using it everything on the phone is going to be awake causing the battery to drain even though I'm not using it.
That is my understanding. Because the gyro senses movement.

thread.text: We are having the same problem on 3 VZW M9 phones.

I've had battery issues as well since 6.0 was installed. The phone is fine in general until I start texting. Texting now seems to be a significant drain on my battery. About 1% usage for ever 3-4 messages sent/received. Using other apps don't have the same affect on battery life.

I'm definitely having both issues since the Marshmallow update. Significant battery drain and really poor WiFi performance...both Chrome and Dolphin Browser seem to have issues loading pages over WiFi. Phone also gets hotter than ever too. Anyone have any recommendations for fixing either of these without rooting? My employer won't allow rooting. 
Posted via the Android Central App
I know this is a Verizon forum but has anyone noticed that the mobile data sleep option is removed since mm update?
I'm also having issues with battery drainage since the update. I've tried to pinpoint it with Gsam and the native battery usage app in the settings, but really can't figure out what is running.
I read somewhere that scanning Always Available" option has been moved to Location->Menu->Wi-Fi Scanning. Maybe this would help.

I had an issue with my T-Mobile M9 draining 30% of power in 6-7 hours (when I was asleep) with all apps closed and the phone restarted. I got fed up with the power drain and factory reset the phone. Since that factory reset, the battery life has been amazing. I now lose about 3% of power in that time frame. I also noticed after the factory reset, the home screen locked changed. Not sure why that is as I had updated my phone's apps fully prior to factory resetting. Factory resetting is probably not what you want to hear, but it worked for me.

Definitely don't want to hear factory resetting. I've been doing some tests and noticed my battery issues are most prevalent when I'm connected to my company's wi-fi. I think the fact that there are numerous access points throughout the building that the phone may be getting bombarded on staying connected to just one. I mean there is an access point in every conference room and one about every 30 ft in the actual office space. 
I know the other battery issue is Candy Crush. That game eats an insane amount of battery as compared to streaming video. I get almost 2x the battery life streaming videos then I do playing that stupid game.

Is this normal: I have been using my phone for just over an hour for internet browsing and social network apps and the battery has dropped 14%.(Wi-Fi + battery saving location).
Posted via the Android Central App
I have a feeling my battery drain has something to do with this. The OS thinks there's no signal and probably using more power to transmit. Anybody else see this on their phone?

title: First HTC phone - second hand and need help

thread.text:
Hi 
The HTC M9 phone I have which is second hand, has the attached screen showing and I cannot get past this screen. 
I am not sure what to do - it has been used by someone who used developer functionality I think, and was wiped before he gave it to me. 
How can I set it up to use?
It isn't being recognised by my laptop or the HTC Manager. I have updated the drivers when it did connect (once) and they were fine. 
Thank you for any help you can give me - I am looking forward to getting to know the phone and play around and learn once I can get into it!
When you reboot, does it bring you straight back to this screen?

Hi 
Thanks for replying - yes it does. All of the options show lead back to this screen.
So it won't boot into recovery mode

It goes to recovery mode with a red triangle with an exclamation point inside, then nothing. 
I saw on another threat holding volume up button and power button, that lead to the menu as in the picture attached again. 
Is it another button combination? Sorry, this all seems like really basic stuff to you I guess!

Nope, I think it is power and volume down button to get to recovery. Try that. Otherwise as in your image, use the volume key to page up and down and the power key as the enter key. Page down to reboot to recovery and hit the power button.

Ok, so I get to the Red Triangle screen, then nothing happens. I wait a couple of minutes and it reboots to the screenshot again. 
I am guessing that maybe the previous owner wiped all operating systems or something?

I'm not too familiar with HTC phones, but it looks like it. I think the best would be to get it back to stock and start from scratch. Try out this link http://forum.xda-developers.com/one-...s-off-t3091730
The instructions are straight forward. Unfortunately I have to run, but I'll check in later. Let us know how it goes. If you get stuck, xda forums will be a great help. Later

Ok, thank you for all of your help. I will check out the link and give it a go. 
Thanks!

Hi, 
The link worked but the the Ruu.zip has been removed. 
I contacted HTC support, they gave the following instructions
1. Press Volume Down two times to highlight reboot to bootloader.
2. Press the Power key to select reboot to bootloader.
3. When the white bootloader screen appears, press the Volume Down key three times to highlight BOOT TO RECOVERY MODE.
4. Press the Power key to select BOOT TO RECOVERY MODE.
5. Wait up to 2 minutes for another black screen with red and blue text to appear. Note: If a device with a red triangle and exclamation point appears, Hold Power while pressing and releasing Volume Up to continue.
6. Press Volume Down three times to highlight wipe cache partition
7. Press the Power key to select wipe cache partition.
8. Once complete, press the Power key again to select reboot system now.
Which bought me back to the same screen as screenshot. They advised then a factory reset, which I did which again bought me back to screenshot. 
Then they said a repair is the only way to go.

Sounds to me you will need to flash a factory ROM. You will have to find the exact model variant of your M9 and find the corresponding factory RUU files from HTC support site. Then, boot into recovery mode and allow RUU on the PC to flash your phone.
Ok, thank you. What do you mean by flash?

Flash a ROM, e.g. update the phone's firmware.
I hope you really got a good deal on this phone (like next to nothing). It looks like your previous owner of the phone screwed up the phone really bad. It could potentially be a brick (never can be recovered).

Hi, 
Thanks for replying again - ah ok, thanks for explaining. I got the ROM but the phone isn't being recognised on my PC at all so can't connect to try to install it even with rebooting the PC and phone repeatedly. 
Was given the phone by my brother in law, he wiped it to give to me, but think he may have gone a bit too far...
Thank you for your help, looks like I am at a bit of a dead end!
I never flashed HTC phone before. But I think if you boot it into recovery mode first. Then connect to PC and your RUU package may recognize the phone.

Hey, 
Thanks, I tried that but the RUU couldn't locate the phone. Think will ask my brother in law to send it for a repair!!
Thank you for all of your suggestions.

title: Help with screen timeout not locking screen.

thread.text:
Okay so I've had my replacement Sprint HTC One M9 for about a few days now. Has the newest OS, and software updates. The problem I'm having is that my lock screen seems to be buggy. 
I have my display timeout set to 45 seconds, but I don't have a security screen. Just the "swipe" option, meaning in theory everytime the screen shuts off, I should have to swipe it up to unlock the phone after pushing the power button. The problem is, that doesn't work when the screen shuts off by the 45 second timeout. If the screen times out, and I press the power button, the phone just goes to the home screen, with no swipe screen to keep the phone from accidentally getting unlocked. This has caused me to open y phone a few times while in my pocket. 
But, when I have the phone on, and I manually shut off the screen with the power button, the lock screen with swipe seems to work when I turn the phone on again. But only if I manually shut the screen with the power button. I know my previous M9 didn't do that. That phone, the lock screen would have swipe regardless. Also, my HTC One M7 didn't have this problem. 
So did HTC just shaft me and change the way they do lock screen? Because I really don't want to have to put a password lock, and set it to "power button automatically locks", and lock time "immediately" to make the phone lock both by screen timeout, and by power button just to keep the phone from accidentally getting unlocked. That's very negative Nancy.

replies.text:
Welcome to Android Central! 
Did you ever figure this out?

thread.text:
I wouldn't say they shafted you but yes it is pretty much like Android is requiring a lock beginning with this new OS. Services like Google Wallet won't work without it. 
As for your phone opening in your pocket, while I do use a lock screen, I've found that I can sometimes find my device waiting for the lock input if I'm hot and perspiring a little. I think this is due to the motion gestures I have set. 
Being warm and humid doesn't explain the issue of being able to watch the screen timeout and touching the power button only to find it still unlocked. For that I have two possibilities. One, and I can't test this, but I also feel like it's the least likely so all you can do is look and see, but in your security settings there's a timer for how soon the lock screen will activate. Since I'm using the lock screen this setting is open for me but with you not using the lock screen I think it maybe greyed out. If not make sure it's set to effect immediately. Any time set there will cause a delay. Since I'm using the lock screen and have that setting open, even if I set the screen timeout to 10 sec my phone won't lock until that times out even if I press the power button, and I think the power button is the key here. 
The use of the power button brings up my second more plausible theory. Something is keeping your phone awake. If you press the power button you are intentionally telling the device it's time to sleep. When you let the screen time out the phone is in limbo because of this other app that's running. The app thinks, "the screen's off but I can run screen on or off, IDC." So the key will be to find this app. That would be where I'd start. There are several different ways to try and see what's running or keeping the phone awake. Looking at the power screen, looking at the app manager in the setting, looking at permissions, there are even apps that will tell you what's keeping your phone from sleeping. 
Know this tho. I wouldn't install an app killer because they just eat up battery and resources trying to stop apps that are only going to reopen a moment later. If you find something try its settings or some onboard method to solve this.
Posted via the Android Central App

title: HTC M9 and Honda bluetooth issues..can I get some help?

thread.text:
I own a 2005 Acura RL. For the most part the bluetooth stays connected in that car. I work for a Honda dealer. I take many different year cars to the auction every week. Some year Honda/Acura cars are constantly dropping and reconnecting bluetooth. This can happen while I am on the phone or while idle. The screen in the car will show bluetooth disconnected and then it will reconnect a few seconds later. When I am on the phone the call will switch back to the handset and then back to the car a few seconds later. 
This has been happening through all of the different Android updates I have tried including Marshmallow that I have installed now. 
I have ready many posts about this but no solution. Since I have access to many different make and year Hondas I figured maybe I could help to narrow down the issue.
Anyone????
Anyone???

Get a different phone. That's probably your only option. I have seen my M9 disconnects from my home BT sync frequently. I have to either reboot the phone or BT sync device to stop the mad connect/disconnect cycle. I have used many different phones, M9 is the worst on BT connectivity.

I love my M9 except for this BT issue and the camera is far from the best. This is my fourth HTC phone in a row and I have no intentions of changing to another brand. 
Any other suggestions?

Some perspective for the readers:
I have NEVER had any BT connection issues with my Sprint M9 and Subaru Forester, so YMMV

Rather than waste your time trying to pair an M9 with anything, I think the best solution is to use an aftermarket bluetooth car kit. I was able to half-way pair my M9 with my BMW (by refusing to let it access my contacts), but since Marshmallow update it won't even allow that option. It goes into about a 5 minute loop where it will pair and then freeze while looking for contacts (even though I indicate not to allow it to), then just drops the phone from available devices. I gave up and bought a Kinivo bluetooth hands-free kit from Amazon for $35 that works better than stock. It plugs into 12V and auxiliary jack, is small and unobtrusive, and I get streaming media using the aptX codec, which the M9 supports and which dramatically improves bluetooth sound. The only downside is not having my info show up on my i-drive screen, but I have the phone in a cradle anyway, and Google voice search works way better than the voice command for my car. For me it was a better solution than buying a new phone or a new car.

title: After the Marshmallow update, why isn't my M9 sd card mounting on my Mac osx El Capitan?

thread.text: I have an HTC m9 and used to be able to plug my usb to the mac and iphoto would mount my external sd card where I store all my camera shots, the mac running is os x el capitan. The mac for some reason is not mounting the card, however I am able to use HTC Sync Manager but really miss the simplicity of Iphoto. Now when I plug my phone to the computer I get the usual usb options, charging, file transfer, MIDI, etc, but when I choose file transfer nothing happens. I have rebooted both phones and mac, tried different cables and check the developer options(usb debugging).

replies.text: I have the same problem. Worked well before the update and now it doesn't. Still works normally on my PC. I've installed Android File Transfer on my Mac, and that works like a file explorer.... Not sure, and nobody else seems to know why it changed....

thread.text:
I assume you guys are using the USB connection from phone to Mac, not taking out of the microSD card and insert into a card reader on Mac. Google has been moving towards supporting MTP protocol only since KitKat on USB connection. This allows better interactions between the host PC and the storage (it allows both phone and PC to access the same storage at the same time). OEMs like HTC and Samsung still offers classical USB mass storage mode on their phones. Nexus phones no longer offer that mode, IIRC. Mass storage only allows either phone or PC to acccess the storage, not both. I suspect the Marshmallow update either took that away or make the MTP as the default protocol. 
The problem is MTP protocol is never supported in Mac OS (along with many other common stuff that is supported on PC). So, check your phone and see if there is a setting to allow you to change back to Mass Storage USB mode.
Looks like that isn't an option anymore... I can use Android File Transfer on my Mac or just use my PC laptops...

title: total solar eclipse

thread.text:
Hi.. i'm htc m9+ user.. i'm from indonesia. I wanna ask for camera setting to take a picture solar eclipse tommorow..
Posted via the Android Central App

replies.text:
Here's what I found on Google. Good Luck! 
Camera settings are quite simple. Here is what I recommend:
Set your camera and lens on a tripod.
Set your ISO to the lowest value like 100.
Set your camera mode to Manual.
Start out at the fastest shutter speed your camera has to offer, such as 1/8000 and see if you need to lower it.
Start out at f/8 and stop down a little more if the shutter speed is too fast. If the sun comes out too bright and overexposed, it means that you are using a weak ND filter.
Depending on what ND filter you are using, your shutter speed should be fast enough to not cause any vibration issues. I was shooting between 1/500 to 1/8000, depending on the phase of the eclipse and how bright I wanted to sun to come out.
